abstract.p: Mary J Blige, credited with creating hip-hop soul, will perform at New Jersey Performing Arts Center and Blockbuster Sony Entertainment Center in Camden, NJ (S)

block.p: Mary J. Blige can be credited with creating a new genre of music -- hip-hop soul. Since her format-busting debut -- 1992's ''What's the 411?'' -- to the current high-gloss soul-pop of ''Mary,'' Ms. Blige has proven to be an artist of great merit. She's evolved from the raw heartbreak themes of her earlier work to the more spiritual and lush. There is still sadness inherent in most of her work, but there is great strength as well.

Mary J. Blige can be credited with creating a new genre of music -- hip-hop soul. Since her format-busting debut -- 1992's ''What's the 411?'' -- to the current high-gloss soul-pop of ''Mary,'' Ms. Blige has proven to be an artist of great merit. She's evolved from the raw heartbreak themes of her earlier work to the more spiritual and lush. There is still sadness inherent in most of her work, but there is great strength as well.
She plays the New Jersey Performing Arts Center at 8 p.m. on Friday and the Blockbuster Sony Entertainment Center in Camden at 8 p.m. next Saturday.
